title: Purdue Protocol Shakedown Testing
subtitle: ARDC Survey, Manual Audiometry, Calibration, Swept DPOAE, WAI, MRT.
instructionText: Choose the exams to perform, then view results.

pages.title: Purdue Protocol
pages.questionMainText: Please select a protocol to perform:

pages.instructionText: To be completed by researcher:

inputList.text: Subject ID
Researcher
Today's Date
Name of Study

pages.instructionText: To be completed by participant:

inputList.text: Birhtdate
Age
Gender
Are you a native speaker of American English?
Do you speak other languages other than English?
If yes, what languages?
Are you on an F1 or J1 Visa?
inputList.notes: **If yes, in order to be paid you will need to provide a copy of: I-94/ I/94W card, Visa, Passport, Tax Summary Report (from Glacier System), Form I- 20 (F1 visa only), For DS2019 (J1 Visa only)

inputList.text: Do you have a hearing loss?
options: Yes, I have a diagnosed hearing loss
Maybe, I or others suspect I have a hearing loss, but I have not been tested
No, I do not have trouble hearing

inputList.text: Do you consider yourself regularly exposed to noise (e.g., play in a band, have a job with noisy tools/machines)?
Do you have frequent ringing in your hears (tinnitus)?
Where did you learn about our study?

pages.instructionText: Please fill in the following so that we can report to federal funding agencies (e.g., National Institutes of Health) the percentage of our subjects in each of their categories. NOTE: The information requested below is optional. You are not obligated to provide this information.

inputList.text: Part A: Check the category that describes you best:
Part B: Please check all the categories that apply:
options: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

pages.instructionText: This is a survey about hearing for individuals participating in study at the Audiology Research Diagnostics Core (ARDC) at Purdue University. Please answer the following questions to the best of your knowledge. This information is requested purely for research purposes and is not intended to help provide any clinical information.

inputList.text: Have you ever had tubes put in your eardrum(s)?
Have you ever had a ruptured eardrum?
If yes, at what age?
If yes, which ear was affected?
Have you ever had a job where you were routinely exposed to very loud sounds, such as military experience with artillery, construction or factory work?
If yes, at what age(s) and for how long?
If yes, about what percentage of the time did you use ear protection?
If yes, please describe the job(s)
Have you ever had any hobbies that involved loud sounds, such as hunting, riding motorcycles, carpentry, frequently attending concerts?
If yes, at what age(s) and for how long?
If yes, about what percentage of the time did you use ear protection?
If yes, please describe the hobby(ies)
Have you ever experienced temporary noises (ringing, buzzing, hiss, swishing, etc...) in your ears after exposure to loud sounds?
If yes, how often do you experience these noises (occasionally, constantly)?
Have you ever temporarily lost your hearing?
If yes, at what age(s) and for how long?
If yes, what was the cause?
Do sounds ever seem distorted to you?
If yes, please explain.
When you are having a conversation in a noisy place, such as a restaurant or bar, can you understand what is being said as well as everyone else can?
If no, please explain.
Have you had sinus problems or sinus surgery?
If yes, please explain.
Have you had a major blow to the head or any other head trauma?
inputList.notes: If yes, please answer the following. If you've had more than one instance of head trauma, please answer for each time it occurred.

inputList.text: How old were you?
What happened?
Were you diagnosed with a concussion?
Select any of the following which accompanied the head trauma:
options: Headaches or weakness persisting days afterward
Dizziness or balance problems persisting days afterward

inputList.text: If you lost consciousness, how long?
Have you ever had a whiplash injury, as might happen in a car collision?
If yes, please explain.
Do places on or near your ear hurt when you press on them?
If yes, on which side?
Have you ever experienced a sharp pain in the ear or an aching ear that was not from an ear infection?
If yes, on which side?
If yes, when and for how long?
Did any event seem to trigger these symptoms?

Have you ever experienced a sensation of 'ear fullness' or 'blockage' and or muffled hearing that lasted for more than a few minutes and was not due to a pressure change (such as during a plane flight, for instance)?
If yes, on which side?
If yes, when and for how long?
Did any event seem to trigger these symptoms?
Have you been told you grind your teeth when you sleep?
Have you ever been diagnosed with any of the following? Select all that apply:
options: Attention Deficit or Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorders (ADD/ADHD)

inputList.text: If you selected 'Other neurological or psychiatric disorder', please list:
How often do you experience balance problems? Please select "Never", "Sometimes", "Often", or "Always".
If "Often" or "Always", please explain:
Do certain sounds irritate you more than they would other people?
If yes, (a) list the sounds and (b) rate how irritating each sound is on a 0 (not at all) to 100 (extremely) scale:
Are you bothered by bright lights?
Are you bothered by certain colors?
If yes, rate how much on a 0 (not at all) to 100 (extremely bothersome) scale:
Are you bothered by strong smells?
If yes, rate how much on a 0 (not at all) to 100 (extremely bothersome) scale:
Are you bothered by certain tastes?
If yes, rate how much on a 0 (not at all) to 100 (extremely bothersome) scale:
Are you bothered by certain types of touch?
If yes, rate how much on a 0 (not at all) to 100 (extremely bothersome) scale:
How many years of education have you completed (beyond kindergarten)?
What is the nature of your current job? Select all that apply:
options: Researcher. Please specify area, e.g., humanities, physics, etc.:

inputList.text: If researcher or other, please specify:

Is your hearing particularly important for your job or for activities you do often? Or for any other research studies you may have participated in recently? (Some examples: birding, sound engineer, other research studies on hearing, playing a musical instrument.)
If yes, please describe the activities and the role hearing plays (for example, "I have to listen for faint sounds."):
Approximately how often do you listen for very faint sounds, listen for slight differences between sounds, or concentrate on the pitch or other features of sounds?
options: More than occasionally, but less than 1 hour per day

inputList.text: Are you currently under any medication? If so, please specify:
Have you ever had any of the following ear problems:
If you or a family member have experienced ANY hearing or ear problems not covered in the survey so far, please describe and briefly explain:
Medical history - Please select any of the following conditions that have ever applied to you:
Medications - Please check the corresponding box if you have ever taken these medications:
Amplification - Have any of these ever applied to you?
If you have any previous use of or experience with amplification as listed above, please describe and briefly explain:
If you have any other previous use of or experience with amplification that were not listed, please describe and briefly explain:

pages.instructionText: The following questions ask about your ability and experiences hearing and listening in different situations. For each question, select a number from 0 through 10 on the scale below the question. Selecting 10 means you would be perfectly able to do or experience what is described in the question. Selecting 0 means you would be unable to do or experience what is described.  We expect that all the questions are relevant to your everyday experience, but if a question describes a situation that does not apply to you, put a cross in the 'not applicable' box.

questions: You are in a group of about five people, sitting round a table. It is an otherwise quiet place. You can see everyone else in the group. Can you follow the conversation?
You are talking with one other person. There is continuous background noise, such as a fan or running water close by. Can you follow what the person says?
You are in a group of about five people in a busy restaurant. You CANNOT see everyone else in the group. Can you follow the conversation?
You are talking to someone in a place where there are a lot of echoes, such as in a church or railway station. Can you follow what the other person says?
You are having a conversation with one person in a room where there are many other people talking. Can you follow what the person you are talking to is saying?
You are sitting around a table or at a meeting with several people. You can't see everyone. Can you tell where any person is as soon as they start speaking?
You are sitting in between two people. One of them starts to speak. Can you tell right away whether it is the person on your left or your right, without having to look?
You are in an unfamiliar house. It is quiet. You hear a door slam. Can you tell right away where that sound came from?

pages.instructionText: We thank you for your time spent taking this survey. Your response has been recorded.

This is a simple survey about perception of sound loudness and annoyance for participants scheduled for a study at the Audiology Research Diagnostics Core (ARDC) at Purdue University. Please answer the following questions to the best of your knowledge. This information is requested purely for research purposes  and is not intended to help provide any clinical information.

Some everyday sounds are loud and some are soft. Some everyday sounds are annoying and some are not. Please rate the loudness and the annoyance of the following sounds. Do not consider the annoyance when rating the loudness and do not consider the loudness when rating the annoyance. For example, a sound may be very loud, but not annoy you. Likewise, a sound may be very soft, yet be very annoying. Rate the sounds using a scale from 0 (not loud/annoying) to 100 (unbearably loud/annoying).
Barking dog next to you

inputList.text: Loudness (0-100)
Annoyance (0-100)

pages.instructionText: Dishes clanking together in the same room

inputList.text: Loudness (0-100)
Annoyance (0-100)

pages.instructionText: Music on the radio in a car when the volume is adjusted for normal-hearing listeners

inputList.text: Loudness (0-100)
Annoyance (0-100)

pages.instructionText: Music on the radio in a quiet room when the volume is adjusted for normal-hearing listeners

inputList.text: Loudness (0-100)
Annoyance (0-100)

pages.instructionText: Telephone ringing in the same room

inputList.text: Loudness (0-100)
Annoyance (0-100)

pages.instructionText: Television in the same room when the volume is adjusted for normal-hearing listeners

inputList.text: Loudness (0-100)
Annoyance (0-100)

pages.instructionText: Lawn mower running next to you

inputList.text: Loudness (0-100)
Annoyance (0-100)

pages.instructionText: Car door closing next to you

inputList.text: Loudness (0-100)
Annoyance (0-100)

pages.instructionText: Someone talking to you in a noisy restaurant

inputList.text: Loudness (0-100)
Annoyance (0-100)

pages.instructionText: Baby crying in the same room

inputList.text: Loudness (0-100)
Annoyance (0-100)

pages.instructionText: Someone chewing food or gum

inputList.text: Loudness (0-100)
Annoyance (0-100)

pages.instructionText: Someone sniffling or clearing their throat

inputList.text: Loudness (0-100)
Annoyance (0-100)

pages.instructionText: The following questions relate to hearing loss, tinnitus, and hyperacusis. Hyperacusis is when sounds that are moderately loud for other people are too loud for you. Please rate your agreement/disagreement with the following statements, using a scale from 0 (completely disagree) to 100 (completely agree).
Because sounds are too loud...

inputList.text: You avoid shopping (0-100)
You do not go out with your friends (0-100)
You have given up some hobbies (0-100)
You do not go to restaurants (0-100)
You avoid being in crowds (0-100)
You feel depressed (0-100)
You feel anxious (0-100)
You are not able to concentrate (0-100)
Your quality of life is poor (0-100)
You are not able to perform tasks or jobs as well (0-100)

pages.instructionText: We thank you for your time spent taking this survey. Your response has been recorded.

Please answer the following questions about yourself, your hearing, and any noise you may have been around during the past year. Write an answer in the fields provided or select the best answer to each question. Be sure to complete all questions.
Part A: Please answer these general questions about your hearing and any loud sounds during the past year (12 months).

inputList.text: How often were you around or did you shoot firearms such as rifles, pistols, shotguns, etc.?
How often were you exposed to loud sounds while working on a paid job? By loud sounds, we mean sounds so loud that you had to speak in a raised voice or shout to be heard at arm's length.

How often were you exposed to any other types of loud sounds, such as power tools, lawn equipment, or loud personal/concert music? By loud sounds, we mean sounds so loud that you had to speak in a raised voice or shout to be heard at arm's length.
How often were you exposed to loud sound that made your ears 'ring' or 'buzz'?
How often were you exposed to loud sound that made your hearing seem muffled for a while?
How often were you exposed to loud sound that made your ears hurt, feel 'full', or bother you in any other way?

pages.instructionText: Part B: Please answer these detailed questions about any loud sounds during the past year (12 months).

inputList.text: Outside of a paid job, how often did you use power tools, chainsaws, or other shop tools?
If you used power tools, on average, how many hours did each time/session last?
If you used power tools, how often did you wear earplugs or earmuffs during this activity?
What kind of earplugs?
Outside of a paid job, how often did you drive heavy equipment or use loud machinery (such as tractors, trucks, or farming or lawn equipment like mowers/leaf blowers)?
If you drove/used loud machinery, on average, how many hours did each time/session last?
If you drove/used machinery, how often did you wear earplugs or earmuffs during this activity?
Please indicate what kind of earplugs you wore in the field provided:
How often did you attend car/truck races, commercial/high school sporting events, music concerts/dances or any other events with amplified public announcement (PA)/music systems?
If you attended these events, on average, how many hours did each time/session last?
If you attended these events, how often did you wear earplugs or earmuffs during this activity?
Please indicate what kind of earplugs you wore in the field provided:
How often did you ride or operate motorized vehicles such as motorcycles, jet skis, speed boats, snowmobiles, or four-wheelers?
If you rode motorized vehicles, on average, how many hours did each time/session last?
If you rode motorized vehicles, how often did you wear earplugs or earmuffs during this activity?
Please indicate what kind of earplugs you wore in the field provided:
If you rode motorized vehicles, describe the vehicle:
How often did you ride in or pilot small aircraft/private airplanes?
If you flew aircrafts, on average, how many hours did each time/session last?
If you flew aircrafts, how often did you wear earplugs or earmuffs during this activity?
Please indicate what kind of earplugs you wore in the field provided:
How often were you around or did you shoot firearms such as rifles, pistols, shotguns, etc.?
If you were around/shot firearms, on average, how many shots did you fire each time/session?
If you were around/shot firearms, on average, how many shots did you fire each time/session?
If you were around/shot firearms, how often did you wear earplugs or earmuffs while shooting?
Please indicate what kind of earplugs you wore in the field provided:
How often were you around firecrackers or other fireworks?
If you were around fireworks, on average, how many fireworks did you shoot each time/session?
If you were around fireworks, how often did you wear earplugs or earmuffs during this activity?
Please indicate what kind of earplugs you wore in the field provided:
How often did you play a musical instrument?
If you played, please tell us what musical instrument:
If you played a musical instrument, how often did you wear earplugs or earmuffs while playing?
Please indicate what kind of earplugs you wore in the field provided:
How often did you listen to music, radio programs, etc. using personal headsets or earphones?
If you listened through earphones, on average, how many hours did each time/session last?
If you listened through earphones, what was the typical volume setting (control knob rotation) when listening?
Other than music concerts and headset use, how often did you listen to music, radio programs, etc. from audio speakers in a car or at home?
If you listened via speakers, on average, how many hours did each time/session last?
If you listened via speakers, what was the typical volume setting (control knob rotation)?
How often did you go to a dance club or nightclub?
On average, how many hours did each time/session last?
How often did you wear earplugs or earmuffs during this activity?
Please indicate what kind of earplugs you wore in the field provided:

pages.instructionText: For the questions below, note different time-frames:

inputList.text: Now think back to this past summer. Over the summer months, did you work a noisy paid job, such as in construction, farming, a factory, lawn service, carwash, or other indoor or outdoor job working around loud equipment or machinery? By noisy job, we mean sounds so loud that you had to speak in a raised voice or shout to be heard at arm's length.
If yes, please describe the noisy job:
If you worked a noisy job, please estimate the number of hours you worked in a typical week. Hours worked per typical week this summer:
How often did you wear earplugs or earmuffs when around loud noises at this summer job?
What kind of earplugs did you use?

Other than during the summer, over the past year, did you work one or more noisy paid jobs, such as in construction, farming, a factory, lawn service, carwash, or other indoor or outdoor job working around loud equipment or machinery? By noisy job, we mean sounds so loud that you had to speak in a raised voice or shout to be heard at arm's length.
inputList.notes: (if no, you're done with this page of the survey)

inputList.text: If yes, please describe the noisy job:
If you worked a noisy job, please estimate the number of hours you worked in a typical week.
How often did you wear earplugs or earmuffs when around loud noises at this job?
Please indicate what kind of earplugs you wore in the field provided:

pages.instructionText: Thinking about your general lifestyle (both current and years past), please answer the following questions. For each activity, select the one field that best describes how often you typically go out to that kind of place/event. In the last column enter an estimate (in hours) of how long one such visit typically lasted.

inputList.text: How often you typically go out to a dance club or night club?
options: About once or twice a year

inputList.text: Did you wear hearing protection while participating in this activity?
How long did such visits last? (hours)
How often you typically go out to a pop/rock concert at a large venue (e.g., stadium entertainment center)?
options: About once or twice a year

inputList.text: Did you wear hearing protection while participating in this activity?
How long did such visits last? (hours)
How often you typically go out to a live gig or music performance at a smaller venue?
options: About once or twice a year

inputList.text: Did you wear hearing protection while participating in this activity?

How often you typically shoot (e.g., pistol club, cadet training, target shooting) - whether you use a gun yourself or are close to someone else using a gun?

Are you regularly exposed to loud noise at work in your current job/s? By loud noise, we mean noise loud enough that you have to raise your voice to be heard by someone at arm's length. This may include power tools or machinery, or loud music or crowds of people.
If yes, please describe what the sources of noise are, and how long you are exposed to them per day:
